io.launchowl.viewvalidationlibrary

Interface Criteria.Condition<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of View being evaluated
    Enclosing class:
    Criteria<T extends android.view.View>

    public static interface Criteria.Condition<T>
    A condition is a single test that will return true or false.

    Conditions are intended to test a single event. Add additional conditions to a Criteria instance to test each unique event.

    For example, one condition could test whether a username contains valid characters. A separate condition could test whether the username contains profanity.

    See Also:
    Criteria.AsyncCondition

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean evaluate(T view)
      Perform a test using information from the view being evaluated.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        boolean evaluate(T view)
        Perform a test using information from the view being evaluated. 

          // Assumes view is a android.widget.TextView
  // Make sure the username contains a fruit
  String[] fruit = {
   "apple",
   "banana",
   "blueberry",
   "kiwi",
   "orange",
   "strawberry"
  };
  Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile(TextUtils.join("|", fruit));
  Matcher matcher = pattern.matcher(view.getText().toString().toLowerCase());
  return matcher.find();
        Parameters:
        view - the View being evaluated
        Returns:
        true or false depending on whether the test passed
